channel.title: Need help with CacheDownloader please!
channel.description:
I have been at it for days trying to fix the problem but I can't seem to find the issue.. whenever I try to run my client I get this error: TrisidiaX is Loading.. java.util.ZipException: error in opening zip file at java.util.zip.ZipFile.open(Native Method) at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(Unknown Source) at Update.unZipFile(Update.java:53) at Update.<init>(Update.java:29) at client.streamLoaderForName(client.java:4918) at client.startUp(client.java:9387) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:6303) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
If you can help me with fixing my CacheDownloader I would greatly appreciate it, I'm running a PI server btw.

item.title: Need help with CacheDownloader please!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Shroomy317, post:5, topic:550627”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=669538.msg4477193#msg4477193 date=1426708333]
Try right clicking somewhere on the windows scene (whether in a folder or on desktop), hover the “New” option so the tree expands, and then click either “Zip archive” or “WinRAR Zip archive” whichever one shows for you. They’re the same thing.

Now select all the files in your cache, and drop them onto the zip file, it should begin copying them to the zip.

Upload that zip file and change your links accordingly.
[/quote]
I tried twice, there are folders inside the cache, like sprites and what not. Do i have to take those out? I have no idea what could be going wrong.[/quote]
No, you keep those folders, it’s how the cache unpacks. The downloader creates the folder for your cache, then downloads the .zip into the new folder, and then extracts the cache from the zip.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with CacheDownloader please!
item.dc:creator: @Shroomy317 Shroomy317
item.description:
@Shroomy317 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:550627”]Try right clicking somewhere on the windows scene (whether in a folder or on desktop), hover the “New” option so the tree expands, and then click either “Zip archive” or “WinRAR Zip archive” whichever one shows for you. They’re the same thing.

Now select all the files in your cache, and drop them onto the zip file, it should begin copying them to the zip.

Upload that zip file and change your links accordingly.[/quote]
I tried twice, there are folders inside the cache, like sprites and what not. Do i have to take those out? I have no idea what could be going wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with CacheDownloader please!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Try right clicking somewhere on the windows scene (whether in a folder or on desktop), hover the “New” option so the tree expands, and then click either “Zip archive” or “WinRAR Zip archive” whichever one shows for you. They’re the same thing.

Now select all the files in your cache, and drop them onto the zip file, it should begin copying them to the zip.

Upload that zip file and change your links accordingly.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with CacheDownloader please!
item.dc:creator: @Shroomy317 Shroomy317
item.description:
@Shroomy317 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:550627”]Make sure that you are zipping all the files inside your cache folder, and not the cache folder itself.

Also make sure that you’re using the direct link to the .zip download. So if you took the link and put it in browser, the download would start as soon as you hit enter to go to the page.[/quote]
The link auto downloads and I put only the files in the .zip but it still gives me the same message

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with CacheDownloader please!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Make sure that you are zipping all the files inside your cache folder, and not the cache folder itself.

Also make sure that you’re using the direct link to the .zip download. So if you took the link and put it in browser, the download would start as soon as you hit enter to go to the page.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Shroomy317 Shroomy317
item.description:

I have been at it for days trying to fix the problem but I can’t seem to find the issue… whenever I try to run my client I get this error:
TrisidiaX is Loading…

at client.startUp(client.java:9387)
at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33)
at client.run(client.java:6303)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

If you can help me with fixing my CacheDownloader I would greatly appreciate it, I’m running a PI server btw.
